page.title: 01Gidea Park Area
page.content: Gidea Park is a pleasant residential district within easy commuting distance of London.Most of the houses are privately owned and were built after 1911 when the area received an award for house design.The average price of a semi detached house in 1985 is Â£ 55,000 and houses are in great demand.Our survey shows that homes are well kept and many have such items as computers, video recorders and microwave ovens.Strict control is kept of buildings and trees as parts of Gidea Park are within a conservation area.Several of the larger houses along Main Road have been converted into accommodation for senior citizens.Two of these are run by Romford Baptist Church and another, Jubilee Court, is a complex of flats built by Havering Council in 1977 and overlooks picturesque Raphael Park.
